verses.verse: Now Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Abram<WH87>, Get thee out<WH3212> of thy country<WH776>, and from thy kindred<WH4138>, and from thy father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>, unto the land<WH776> that I will show thee<WH7200>:
and I will make of thee<WH6213> a great<WH1419> nation<WH1471>, and I will bless<WH1288> thee<WH1431>, and make they name<WH8034> great<WH1431>; and be thou a blessing<WH1293>:
and I will bless<WH1288> them that bless<WH1288> thee<WH7043>, and him that curseth thee will I curse<WH779>: and in thee shall all the families<WH4940> of the earth<WH127> be blessed<WH1288>.

So Abram<WH87> went<WH3212>, as Jehovah<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> unto him<WH3876>; and Lot went<WH3212> with him<WH87>: and Abram was seventy<WH7657> and five<WH2568> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he departed<WH3318> out of Haran<WH2771>.

And Abram<WH87> took<WH3947> Sarai<WH8297> his wife<WH802>, and Lot<WH3876> his brother<WH251>'s son<WH1121>, and all their substance<WH7399> that they had gathered<WH7408>, and the souls<WH5315> that they had gotten<WH6213> in Haran<WH2771>; and they went forth<WH3318> to go<WH3212> into the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>; and into the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> they came<WH935>.
And Abram<WH87> passed through<WH5674> the land<WH776> unto the place<WH4725> of Shechem<WH7927>, unto the oak<WH436> of Moreh<WH4176>. And the Canaanite<WH3669> was then<WH227> in the land<WH776>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> unto Abram<WH87>, and said<WH559>, Unto thy seed<WH2233> will I give<WH5414> this<WH2063> land<WH776>: and there builded<WH1129> he an altar<WH4196> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, who appeared unto him<WH7200>.

And he removed<WH6275> from thence unto the mountain<WH2022> on the east<WH6924> of Beth-el<WH1008>, and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168>, having Beth-el<WH1008> on the west<WH3220>, and Ai<WH5857> on the east<WH6924>: and there he builded<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and called<WH7121> upon the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>.
And Abram<WH87> journeyed<WH5265>, going on<WH1980> still<WH5265> toward the South<WH5045>.
And there was a famine<WH7458> in the land<WH776>: and Abram<WH87> went down<WH3381> into Egypt<WH4714> to sojourn<WH1481> there<WH7458>; for the famine was sore<WH3515> in the land<WH776>.

And it came to pass<WH834>, when he was come near<WH7126> to enter<WH935> into Egypt<WH4714>, that he said<WH559> unto Sarai<WH8297> his wife<WH802>, Behold<WH2009> now<WH4994>, I know<WH3045> that thou art a fair<WH3303> woman<WH802> to look upon<WH4758>:
and it will come to pass<WH4713>, when the Egyptians shall see<WH7200> thee<WH559>, that they will say, This is his wife<WH802>: and they will kill<WH2026> me<WH2421>, but they will save thee alive.
Say <WH559>, I pray thee<WH4994>, thou art my sister<WH269>; that<WH4616> it may be well<WH3190> with me for thy sake<WH5315>, and that my soul may live<WH2421> because of thee<WH1558>.
And it came to pass<WH87>, that, when Abram was come<WH935> into Egypt<WH4714>, the Egyptians<WH4713> beheld<WH7200> the woman<WH802> that she was very<WH3966> fair<WH3303>.
And the princes<WH8269> of Pharaoh<WH6547> saw<WH7200> her<WH1984>, and praised her to<WH413> Pharaoh<WH6547>: and the woman<WH802> was taken<WH3947> into Pharaoh<WH6547>'s house<WH1004>.

And he dealt<WH3190> well<WH3190> with Abram<WH87> for her sake<WH6629>: and he had sheep, and oxen<WH1241>, and he-asses<WH2543>, and men-servants<WH5650>, and maid-servants<WH8198>, and she-asses<WH860>, and camels<WH1581>.
And Jehovah<WH3068> plagued<WH5060> Pharaoh<WH6547> and his house<WH1004> with great<WH1419> plagues<WH5061> because of<WH1697> Sarai<WH8297>, Abram<WH87>'s wife<WH802>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> called<WH7121> Abram<WH87>, and said<WH559>, What is this that thou hast done<WH6213> unto me<WH5046>? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife<WH802>?
why saidst thou<WH559>, She is my sister<WH269>, so that I took<WH3947> her to be my wife<WH802>? now therefore behold thy wife<WH802>, take<WH3947> her<WH3212>, and go thy way.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> gave men<WH582> charge<WH6680> concerning him<WH7971>: and they brought him on the way, and his wife<WH802>, and all that he had.
